div.p: Welcome to Post Falls School District #273.

p.span: The Board of Trustees from left to right - Michelle Lippert, Dave Paul, Bonnie Beaulieu, Carol Goodman, and Bridget Eismann.

strong.span: During closure Grab N' Go meals are available at Greensferry, West Ridge, & Ponderosa Elementary; River City MS & Post Falls HS

a.title: Idaho State Department of Education Report Card

li.a: Idaho State Department of Education Report Card

span.p: All kindergarten students will return to their home schools in the fall of 2020. Click here to view the updated attendance zone maps.

Beginning April 28, 2020, parents will have two options to pre-register their incoming kindergarten student. It’s important to pre-register your incoming kindergarten student, so students are included in our preliminary enrollment numbers. These two pre-registration options will be available until June 12.
Option 1: Complete the online pre-registration form. (link coming April 28)

Option 2: Phone pre-registration (Beginning April 28, parents can call the child’s school to pre-register. If you reach the answering machine, please leave a message including your phone number, so office staff can return your call.)

a.title: Click to read more about: Kindergarten Pre-Registration 2020-21 begins April 28th

div.a: Read More about Kindergarten Pre-Registration 2020-21 begins April 28th

span.p: Last week, the Idaho State Board of Education (SBOE) extended the soft closure of all Idaho schools for the remainder of the school year or until local districts are able to meet re-entry criteria. This morning, the SBOE provided guidance for schools to move from soft closure to normal operations. At this time, no schools in Kootenai County are able to meet the minimum requirements set forth by the State Board; therefore, until further notice, the Post Falls School District will remain closed.
The criteria for re-opening schools are as follows:

ul.li: No statewide or local social distancing restrictions, including stay-home orders or extensive closures of businesses are in place.

The peak of the state infection curve has passed as determined by the State Department of Health and Welfare, and a minimum of 14 days have passed from the identified peak. In those areas where local community spread has occurred, the local infection curve will be evaluated for determining the 14 consecutive days.
Approval by the local public health district.

span.p: We will continue our remote learning plan and maintain essential services, including Grab and Go breakfast and lunch and childcare for first responders and health care workers. We will monitor the conditions set forth by the SBOE to determine if we are able to re-open our schools later this spring.
Please continue to help us engage our student(s) in the remote learning activities to prepare your child for the next grade level.
The district office will not be open for walk-in appointments. Please call 208-773-1658 and leave a message or email us at info@sd273.com.

div.a: Remote Learning for K-5 PFSD Students

span.p: Post Falls School District elementary teachers have compiled materials to offer grade level remote learning experiences, and staff have been reaching out to students and families to ensure they have the necessary tools for success in this new remote learning environment. For a smoother transition back into a brick and mortar setting, it is very important students fully engage in remote learning activities. All lessons are tied to district curriculum and Idaho State Standards. During the closure, teachers will be providing students feedback as they progress through the curriculum.

li.span: Access K-5 electronic / online learning materials

span.a: Flyer with meal service locations and details

div.a: PFSD Board of Trustees Selects Next Superintendent

p.img: The Post Falls School District Board of Trustees unanimously voted to hire Dena Naccarato as the next Superintendent starting July 1, 2020. The selection came at the end of a lengthy process that included multiple opportunities for staff, parents and community input as well as a thorough background check. The board rated the candidates based on their application packet, interviews, references, and input from a candidates’ meet and greet. Board Chairman Dave Paul expressed, “We had an outstanding group of finalists; however, Ms. Naccarato rose to the top in all areas of the process. We are excited for her to put her own footprint on the future of Post Falls School District.”

span.p: Dena Naccarato has been with Post Falls School District since 2004, first as an Assistant Principal and then Principal at Post Falls High School. Ms. Naccarato moved to the district office six years ago where she served as the Director of Programs and Instruction and for the past three years as the Assistant Superintendent for Secondary Programs. “I’m humbled and honored at the board’s decision and look forward to working with students, staff, parents and community of Post Falls,” stated Ms. Naccarato. “I will schedule time formally and informally in each building to meet with staff and gather input on the future of the district.”

a.title: Click to read more about: PFSD Board of Trustees Selects Next Superintendent

div.a: Read More about PFSD Board of Trustees Selects Next Superintendent

div.div:
The Post Falls School District has joined the School Messenger emergency notification system.The system allows the district to communicate via SMS text messages to parents regarding important matters such as a school lockdown, school closure (weather or otherwise) or other issues that affect their students.
To receive school notifications you must opt-in to school messenger. Please follow the steps below to opt in: **Send a text message to 67587 with the word “subscribe” in the body of the text. **You will receive a confirmation text reply that you are Registered with School Messenger.
